title: Drawing, ""Chariot of Apollo," Ceiling Design for Count Bielinski's Cabinet, Warsaw, Poland", 1734
medium: Pen and gray ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, gold paint over black chalk on white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed on verso: PLAFOND DE PEINTURE / Pour le Cabinet de M. le Comte de Bielenski grand Mtr. de La Couronne de Pologne.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The central area is taken up with simulated sky with the chariot of Apollo.  Around the edges, allegorical figures seated on clouds; simulated architecture of vaults and pendentives about the outer edges, within an architectural frame.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, ""Chariot of Apollo," Ceiling Design for Count Bielinski's Cabinet, Warsaw, Poland", 1734.
1734. Pen and gray ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, gold paint over black chalk on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-214.
